comment: SEE the 'Latest News' heading on the homepage at details of the October edition of 'Back Tracking' with me on the UK's Riviera FM radio. The show is an "October Hit Songs & Tunes" theme focusing on the s & s & featuring offerings from the likes of Sarah Vaughan (pic); Ella; Crosby; Sinatra & many others.
amr:
# ::snt SEE the 'Latest News' heading on the homepage at details of the October edition of 'Back Tracking' with me on the UK's Riviera FM radio. The show is an "October Hit Songs & Tunes" theme focusing on the s & s & featuring offerings from the likes of Sarah Vaughan (pic); Ella; Crosby; Sinatra & many others.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (s / see-01
            :mode imperative
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (h / heading-01
                  :ARG1 (h2 / homepage)
                  :ARG2 (d / detail-01
                        :ARG1 (e / edition
                              :mod (t / track-01)
                              :time (d2 / date-entity
                                    :month 10)
                              :medium (r / radio
                                    :name (n / name
                                          :op1 "Riviera"
                                          :op2 "FM")
                                    :location (c / country
                                          :name (n2 / name
                                                :op1 "UK"))))))
            :snt2 (t2 / theme
                  :mod (h3 / hit-01
                        :time (d3 / date-entity
                              :month 10))
                  :ARG0-of (f / focus-01
                        :ARG2 (a / and
                              :op1 (a2 / and
                                    :op1 (s2 / s)
                                    :op2 (s3 / s))
                              :op2 (f2 / feature-01
                                    :ARG1 (t3 / thing
                                          :ARG1-of (o / offer-01)
                                          :source (a3 / and
                                                :op1 (p / person
                                                      :name (n3 / name
                                                            :op1 "Sarah"
                                                            :op2 "Vaughan"))
                                                :op2 (p2 / person
                                                      :name (n4 / name
                                                            :op1 "Ella"))
                                                :op3 (p3 / person
                                                      :name (n5 / name
                                                            :op1 "Crosby"))
                                                :op4 (p4 / person
                                                      :name (n6 / name
                                                            :op1 "Sinatra"))
                                                :op5 (o2 / other
                                                      :quant (m2 / many))))))
                        :domain (s4 / show-04)))))

comment: Profanity and discriminatory language does not serve any meaningful purpose.
amr:
# ::snt Profanity and discriminatory language does not serve any meaningful purpose.
(s / serve-01
      :polarity -
      :ARG0 (a / and
            :op1 (p / profanity)
            :op2 (l / language
                  :ARG0-of (d / discriminate-02)))
      :ARG1 (p2 / purpose
            :ARG0-of (m / meaningful-05)
            :mod (a2 / any)))

comment: That is not a convincing way to make an argument. People will listen to you more if you are more civil.
amr:
# ::snt That is not a convincing way to make an argument. People will listen to you more if you are more civil.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (w / way
            :polarity -
            :manner-of (c / convince-01
                  :ARG0 (a / argue-01))
            :domain (t / that))
      :snt2 (l / listen-01
            :ARG0 (p / person)
            :ARG1 (y / you)
            :ARG1-of (h / have-quant-91
                  :ARG3 (m2 / more))
            :condition (c2 / civil
                  :domain y
                  :ARG2-of (h2 / have-degree-91
                        :ARG1 y
                        :ARG3 (m3 / more)))))

comment: User 1's just giving information; no need for attacks if you don't like the post.

(a / and

            :mod (j / just))
      :op2 (n / need-01
